meanings.sent1: She is a bookish girl who always has a novel in hand.
meanings.sent2: The bookish student spent hours in the library every day.
meanings.sent3: The bookish cat knocked over a stack of books while trying to climb the bookshelf.
meanings.sent4: His bookish demeanor made him stand out in a crowd of sports enthusiasts.
meanings.sent5: The bookish atmosphere of the old bookstore was comforting and familiar.

meanings.definition: Characteristic of a book or books.
meanings.sent1: The bookish cover of the novel caught her eye in the bookstore.
meanings.sent2: The bookish smell of old paper filled the room.
meanings.sent3: The bookish design of the library made it a cozy place to study.
meanings.sent4: Her room had a bookish feel with shelves filled to the brim.
meanings.sent5: The bookish illustrations in the children's book were colorful and engaging.

meanings.sent1: His bookish habits led him to excel in school.
meanings.sent2: The bookish professor was known for his insightful lectures.
meanings.sent3: The bookish debate team won the championship with their well-researched arguments.
meanings.sent4: She had a bookish approach to problem-solving, always analyzing every detail.
meanings.sent5: The bookish discussions at the book club were thought-provoking and stimulating.
